alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 11:29AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Little River, northwestern Sevier and eastern McCurtain Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1129 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles south of Octavia to 20 miles west of De Queen to Broken Bow to 8 miles southwest of Idabel. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Queen, Horatio, Idabel, Broken Bow, Gillham, Haworth, Bokhoma, Eagletown, Moon, Cerrogordo, Hochatown, Goodwater, Shinewell, Sherwood, Holly Creek, America, West Line and West Otis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
